finnish.text: He who cannot light a fire knows nothing about love.
Even a small star shines in the darkness.
Go often to the house of a friend; for weeds soon choke up the unused path.
Go often to the house of thy friend; for weeds soon choke up the unused path.
It is the great north wind that made the Vikings.
It is the last straw that breaks the camel's back.
Better one hazel grouse in the bag, than ten on the branch.
Big words won't split ones mouth.
Buy, buy, the children will pay the debts.
Cleanliness is half a meal.
Closeness without conflict only exists in the cemetery.
Cow's diets have never been sustained on grass grown in May.
Cowardice will not prolong life.
Disappears like a fart into Sahara.
Disappears without trace.
Do it today! Tomorrow it might be forbidden.
A month from a skylark, a half from a finch, a little from a wagtail and not a day from a swallow.
A new day shows a new way.
A sauna -- the poor man's pharmacy.
A sauna makes a woman most beautiful one hour after the bath.
A snotnose may grow up to be a man; but he who laughs without cause, never.
A soldier's no boor though no gentleman either.
A town takes your money though your pockets be empty.
A widow, like a widower, is a house without a roof.
A willing helper comes without asking.
Actions have consequences.
Even the clock shows the time without knowing anything.
Even the crow sings with its own voice.
Everyone knows the bear, but the bear knows no one.
Everything is beautiful once the eye likes the view.
Express yourself earnestly, and you have no reason for shame even if you lack talent.
Father's goodness is higher than the mountains. Mother's goodness is deeper than the sea.
Foreign places are nice enough, but home is sweeter.
From small beginnings could come great things.
From the ditch to the water jump.
God did not create haste.
A bird in the hand is worth ten in the bush.
A cat lives on praise, a dog by pats on the head.
A child is like an axe; even if it hurts, you stil carry them on your shoulders.
A Finn doesnï¿½t believe before he has seen.
A good bell is heard from far, a bad one still further.
A good deal for two, is a clip on the ears of a third.
A little bit of experience is better than a barrel full of knowledge.
A man is valued by his work, not his words.
A man without a wife is like a field without a fence.
A married man has many sorrows -- an unmarried man has one more.
Age does not give sense it only makes one go slowly.
Age does not give you good sense, it only makes you go slowly.
All that glitters is not gold, nor all that sparkles silver.
Always exist branch grabbers, when exist fir-tree haulers.
An empty barn needs no roof.
An honest man would rather sell his land than tell a lie.
As we grow older our bad qualities make us younger.
Be always a little afraid so that you never have need of being much afraid.
Being in love is like feeling the sun from both sides.
Better ice that melts than fire that extinguishes.
He who lies thrice believes he's told the truth.
He who praises the past blames the present.
He who shares the meat is always left with the bone.
Help the man climbing a hill, not the one standing below it.
Hope for miracles, but don't rely on one happening.
Hurry, and you'll get only shithead kids.
I love others too, but I love myself more.
If a man knew where he would fall, he would spread straw there first.
If a sauna, whiskey and tar do not help, the disease is fatal.
If tar, hard liquor and sauna do not cure; the disease is fatal.
God did not create hurry.
God never says no to grand thoughts.
Great things often come from small beginnings.
Happens in better families too.
Happiness does not come from happiness itself, but from the journey towards achieving it.
Happiness is a place between too little and too much.
Harmony creates accommodation.
He needs a long candle who awaits the death of another.
He who asks won't lose his way.
The devil dances nowhere as much as between a couple.
The echo knows all languages.
The elderly, even if deaf and blind, still know a lot.
The fate of the Gypsy's horse.
The forest will answer you in the way you call to it.
The frost drives the pig home.
The lazy sweat when they eat and complain of the cold when they work.
The memories of one's youth make for long, long thoughts.
The mocked may grow up to dignity, but the mocker will never outgrow his juvenile behaviour.
The old cow forgets that she was once a calf.
Love is a garden full of flowers and marriage is a field of stinging nettles.
Many cakes are beautiful on the surface, but have crappy fillings.
Money talks all the way to heaven's door.
Money's for buying and a horse is for riding.
Never judge a reindeer from close by when you got it from a rich man because you may find that some of the antlers are missing.
Never leave a mate behind.
No matter how misbehaved a child, the parents will accept.
No need to plough and sow madmen, they grow by themselves.
No one can be an expected to be an expert at something before they have got the chance to practice it.
No one can climb a tree with no branches.
In sunshine the dust is seen.
It is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
It is the dog which is hit by the tossed stick, which yelps.
Judge not the dog by its hair.
Keeping yourself and your food clean, you'll get more from it.
Let's be quiet, we'll get some fish.
Life is uncertain so eat your desert first.
Like two berries.
Love blinds your eyes, marriage opens them wide.
Love came in a paper bag, said the maiden when she got a letter from her sweetheart.
If the bathroom and a brandy cannot help a man, then death is imminent.
If there is someone to haul the fir-tree, there shall be no shortage of those willing to hold a branch to help.
If vodka, tar and sauna don't help, the disease leads to death.
If you borrow some chaff from the rich man you have to repay him with wheat.
If you can not find peace within yourself, it is useless to look elsewhere.
If you have ploughed with oxen, married a widow and never said a bad word - surely you go to heaven.
If you reach for something that is far too good for you, it is not going to end well.
If you're short of trouble take a goat.
In a trade someone always loses.
In heaven you wont hear the mosquitoes.
Skill is not a heavy load to carry.
Sour said the fox about rowan berries.
Such things happen even to better folk.
Take a man by his word, take a bull by its horn.
That dog yelps, which stick hits.
The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
The back has to pay for what the ears didn't hear.
The brave eat the soup, the timid die of hunger.
The cheese betrays the milk.
The child led by the hand never learns to walk.
Piss without farting, die without fucking.
Pissed off like a little squirrel with a frozen pine cone.
Poverty is no joy, although it sometimes makes you laugh.
Praise your horse tomorrow, your son when he has a beard, your daughter when she is married and yourself never.
Pride goes before the fall.
Rain does not stay in the sky.
Rather a man without a cow for the summer than without a wife for Christmas night.
Roll me, don't curse me, said the stone to the ploughman.
Send a child to do your errands, go do them yourself afterwards.
Siberia will teach.
The poor can't afford to buy cheap.
The pot reproaching the kettle.
The walking-stick reaches many lands, the word many more.
The water is the same on both sides of the boat.
The winter does not go without looking backward.
The winter does not leave without a backward glance.
The wise man will be cheated only once.
The wise person is only cheated once.
The world is a good teacher, but it charges a huge fee.
There's a man who looks like a partridge with legs like a mosquito.
When a man remembers the land, the land remembers him.
When something has been denied of you, you can still do it once.
Who reaches for the spruce, falls down onto the juniper.
Who stands by the door of his house is not yet gone away.
Whose bread you eat, his songs you'll sing.
Wise in the morning is wiser in the evening.
With a walking-stick you reach many lands; you reach many more with words.
Work doesn't scare him, but he could lay down near it and sleep.
Work earns a living but trade makes you rich.
Works like the train toilet.
Time goes on while life runs out.
To an optimist every weed is a flower; to a pessimist every flower is a weed.
To be in love is to feel the sun from both sides.
Two are holy: a church and a sauna.
Two do not think the same thoughts together.
War does not determine who is right, only who is remaining.
Water is the oldest medicine.
Water runs a whole mile downstream easier than an inch upstream.
Wet your finger in tar and soon it is all over you.
What adds to knowledge, adds to pain.
You always lose.
You are not a man until you have plowed a field.
You can disguise wealth but you can't hide poverty.
You can't trust that a job will be done properly unless you do it yourself.
You don't get anywhere if you run in your thoughts.
You get a lot of these blows, said the busy bee when he flew against a brick wall.
You're just like a baby; one never knows what comes and when it comes.
Your memory can let you down like it did to a Finn who was carving a wooden spoon.
Don't judge a dog by its hair.
Don't paint the devil on the wall.
Don't paint the image of a demon on a wall.
Don't raise your club so high; it will only fall on your head.
Eat, and small ills disappear.
End well, all well.
Even a pigeon has a pussy
Even a poor man owns the sun and the stars.
Even a stupid one seems wise if he keeps his mouth shut.
No one is a blacksmith when they are born.
No use crying at the market, sell your fur coat and drink the money.
On the gallows, the first night is the worst.
One cannot ski so softly that the tracks cannot be seen.
One sleeps like one makes his bed.
One stupid person asks more than ten wise ones can spare time answering.
One time after the denial.
One year ages the old, two years grow a child.
Other land blueberry; own land strawberry.
Own home is worth gold.
A bark leaves no marks if you donât let the dog bite.
A married man has many sorrows â an unmarried man has one more.
He, who cannot light a fire knows nothing about love.
Even a small star shines in the dark.
In heaven you wonât hear the mosquitoes.
The back has to pay for what the ears didnât hear.
Age does not give you good sense; it only makes you go slowly.
Freedom does not lengthen life.
The memories of oneâs youth make for long, long thoughts.
Donât judge a dog by its hair.
If the bathroom and a brandy cannot help a man, then death is imminent.
He needs a long candle who awaits the death of another.
Not all that shines is gold, nor all that glows is silver.
Little is better than nothing.
Better a bitter truth than a sweet lie.
A tree is climbed from its base.
After the rain, fine weather.
Oneâs own help [is] the best help.
All eggs should not be put in one basket.
A barking dog does not bite.
Who promises a lot, gives a little.
Donât beat the man who has already been beaten.
What is acquired easily is lost easily.
You reap what you sow.
finnish.description: If a farmer plants potatoes, he will get potatoes, not another thing like tomatoes. Therefore, if we do good things we can expect good results, however, is we do wicked things we should expect the consequences.

finnish.text: A small candle can light up the darkest forest.
Silence is gold, talking is silver.
A child who is loved has many names.
A child is like an axe; even if it hurts, you still carry them on your shoulders.
A woman becomes her most beautiful, one hour after taking a sauna.
Geese are caught with Geese.
Do not protect yourself by a stone wall, but rather by your family.
He who shuns the millstone, shuns the meal.
The cat would eat fish, too, but it wouldnât jump into the ocean.
The wolf makes a terrible shepherd.
Such father, such son.
A spot in gold and a fault in a wise man are soon visible.
A fat man is a lazy man.
Donât raise your club so high; it will only fall on your head.
The path of obligation lies down the marriage aisle.
Men seek a warm hearth as termites seek rotten wood.
A fool boasts of his horse, a madman of his wife, the skillfulness of his children.
A small fire in the hearth is better than fleas in the bed.
The cake is fine on top, but there are crickets inside.
Read like the devil reads the Bible.
No smoke without fire.
Foreigners bring fleas to the sauna.
A priest with lice in his beard brings bad luck everywhere he travels.
The lazy man is living behind Godâs back.
A loaf of fresh baked bread brings happiness to even devils.
The apple does not fall far from the tree.
A wife who farts during the supper hour foretells a thunderstorm.
A honey pot often contains wasps.
One who grows up without discipline will die without glory.
A mother-in-law who farts during the supper foretells a good harvest.
The mouth lies, but the eyes tell the truth.
A ring round the sun for rain, a ring round the moon for fine weather.
A poke in the eye for those, who dwell on the past.
Spend, spend, spend â your children will pay the debts.
Not worth it to go further than the sea for fish.
A beloved child has many names.
A child unwilling to be taught must learn to dig trenches.
A wife who cannot cook puts the blame on the pots.
An opportunity makes a thief.
The reins of fortune, the keys to luck, are in the hands of God and not under envyâs arm or at an evil personâs fingertips.
Big fish are worth of fishing even if you donât catch one.
From a word comes a word; from a spark the earth catches fire.
Invite a beggar to break bread and you will be minding the silver all evening.
Be always a little afraid so that you never will be much afraid.
If there is snow in the forest at the New Year, diseases will spread that year.
One shouldnât make a bull out of a fly.
Evil will get its share.
An old dog doesnât bark lies.
Rain in August portend crickets in the tea kettle.
Such mother, such daughter.
The butchers children go to bed hungry.
A tiny morsel is a feast to the starving man.
A laughing ermine eats a goodly cobbler while the weasel dances to his own tune.
The forest answers in the same way one shouts at it.
The mouth brought the wolf into the trap, the tongue the ermine to the snare.
A youth who does not work hard, will be begging will he is old.
The unhappy child cries for toasted snow.
The woman should let the man lead the dance.
Donât look for lice if youâre not itching.
Help a man uphill, not at the foot of the hill.
Winter brings want.
Big words wonât split ones mouth.
When you flee from a wolf, you run into a bear.
Those who wrestle weasels will be scratching for fleas.
